story.text: NEW YORK Jan 3 Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday AvalonBay Communities Inc. (AVB.N) will replace Symbol Technologies Inc. SBL.N in its flagship Standard & Poor's 500 stock index .SPX after the close of trading on a date to be announced. AvalonBay, based in Alexandria, Virginia, is a real estate investment trust specializing in upscale apartment complexes. Symbol, a maker of bar code and inventory scanning technology, agreed last September to be acquired by cell phone maker Motorola Inc. MOT.N for about $3.9 billion. Shares of companies entering the S&P 500 often rise because many portfolio managers try to track the index, and are required to buy its component stocks. AvalonBay shares rose $2.30, or 2.1 percent, to $131.05 in after-hours electronic trading following S&P's announcement. They had fallen $1.30 during regular Wednesday trading.
story.title: avalonbay to join s & p 500 , replacing symbol
